title.narrative: ILO, Road to Jobs in Afghanistan 2014-2020
ILO, vägen till jobb i Afghanistan 2014-2020

description.narrative: Insatsen syfter till att höja inkomstnivåer och sysselsättning för fattiga hushåll på landsbygden i norra Afghanistan, med särskilt fokus på kvinnor. Detta ska uppnås genom att utifrån ett antal valda värdekedjor (som inbegriper samtliga delar i produktions-, transport- och försäljningsprocesserna, samt stödjande aktiviteter i form av rådgivning, prissättning, marknadsföring etc) för jordbruksprodukter mm facilitera undanröjandet av hinder för ökad produktivitet och konkurrenskraft på rurala och urbana marknader. Insatsen bygger på att knyta hushåll på landsbygden närmare marknader i städer genom att utnyttja det vägnät som Sida bidragit till byggts upp på landsbygden i norra Afghanistan.

The project aims to increase incomes and raise employment for poor households in rural areas in northern Afghanistan, with a focus on women. A selection af a number of value chains for agricultural products will be made and obstacles removed for increased productivity an competetiveness at rural and urban markets. The project builds on connecting rural households to urban markets through the rural roads network that Sida has funded in northern Afghanistan

tag.narrative: 1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.

1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.

8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The programme displayed strong progress in 2019 and generated around 1,54 million USD in net additional income for its target groups, of which 83% were self-employed, 10% were workers, 6% were companies, and 1% were farmers. Additionally, 729 new jobs were generated and around 2400 jobs were improved. The vast majority of new and improved jobs were for women. In total, the programme activities benefitted around 28 000 poor men and women, of which the majority were women. Relations and partnerships with Balkh Chamber of Commerce and Investments (BCCI), National Union of Afghanistan Workers and Employees (NUAWE), the Department of Labour and Social Affairs (DoLSA) and the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livelihoods (MAIL) were further built on to drive the decent job creation agenda. The capacity of Afghanistan Women Chamber of Commerce and Industry (AWCCI) was strenghented through trainings. The Womens Economic Empowerment strategy shows results in an increased percentage of women benefiting from new and improved jobs and increased women participation in targetted value chains. In particular the work in the carpets sector has resulted in self-employment for about 100 women from IDP camps in a way where they can work from their homes and still supply companies with demanded carpets, and vocational training in carpet weaving increased the income for over 1500 poor women. Furthermore, the programme facilitated an innovative way of reducing milk-rejection rates which resulted in 500 women dairy farmers from Dawlatabad to be part of the value chain and benefit from increased incomes. Mobile financial services was introduced through risk-sharing by the programme and a mobile operator, which resulted in access to mobile financial services including air-time sales, and mobile money, pay-as-you go solar home system services for almost 7000 users.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
